December 9, 1959 RECEIVED
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
Mr* Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
lh Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
Finally I am enclosing not a rough draft of the
minutes of the Utilization Committee meeting as I said
in my December 2nd letter, but the revised copy of the
minutes • These have been checked by the committee mem¬
bers and, to the best of our knowledge, is the correct
record of the meeting.
On this business of using some Title VII funds to
develop out Utilization Kits; the more I think of this
the more I feel it is a definite possibility* I still
have not heard from Jim McPherson, of the U.S. Office,
concerning the method of introducing your proposal
on Part B of Title VII.
DEC 1 0 1953
7"&|9|10(11|12|1|2,3|4|5|9
l
If you can take the time to discuss this with the
people there, perhaps something can be gotten underway
soon. I would like to work on this project and it-appears
to me that the first stage will be to get around to some
of the areas doing school programming to line up material
for the Utilization Kits• I have the time now and will
not get involved with our local problems until sometime
in February.
If money could be made available so that I could
spend some time during the month of January getting the
project started, then the rest of the year would be time
enough to actually produce the kits. I’m sure I do not
need to point out to you that these have to be planned,
and certainly parts of them produced,while children are
still in school.
